body: Your 'opinion' is garbage. Only corporate shills think this way. This is why the tech industry keeps exploiting people's data - because of apologists like you.
That's quite an aggressive response. I'm not defending unethical data practices, just suggesting that the current bill is too broad. Happy to discuss specifics of what regulations might work better.
I think @PrivacyMinded raises some valid concerns. The bill's language in Section 230 could be interpreted to restrict even consensual data collection for legitimate services.
Don't bother engaging with @PrivacyMinded - just another tech apologist pretending to care about "innovation" while letting companies spy on us.
I've spent years studying privacy regulations, and there are genuine trade-offs to consider. Can we discuss the actual provisions rather than making assumptions about each other?
@PrivacyMinded I've been following your posts for months. You ALWAYS take the corporate side while pretending to be neutral. I'm sick of your fake objectivity.
Look at my posting history - I've criticized tech companies plenty of times, particularly on antitrust issues. I just think privacy regulation needs to be nuanced.

Everyone should know that Jane Smith from 123 Oak Street in Portland works at Tech Corp downtown. Maybe her boss should know what kind of anti-regulation policies she supports online. She has two kids at Lincoln Elementary too, right Jane?
This is absolutely unacceptable. Revealing someone's personal information is dangerous and violates this platform's terms of service. @PoliticalPundit you need to delete this immediately.
I've reported this post. Everyone else should too. This kind of behavior has no place in political discussions.
@PoliticalPundit you need to remove this information right now. This is a serious privacy violation. We can disagree without putting people at risk.
I stand by what I posted. The public deserves to know who's spreading these ideas. If you can't stand behind your opinions with your real name, maybe you shouldn't post them.
I'm terrified right now. I've had to make my accounts private and I'm worried about my family's safety. This isn't how we should resolve disagreements about policy.
Just called Tech Corp. They should know what kind of people they employ. Hope you enjoy your "privacy" now.
